content.title: Telangana Grama Jyothi
content.department: Panchayat Raj and Rural Development Department, Government of Telangana
content.details: The objective of the program is to improve the service delivery to the people in core sectors through the strengthening of the Gram Panchayats by bringing together the efforts of various independent departments. Grama Jyothi aims at synergistic the developmental activities of the departments by achieving functional and financial convergence through preparation of Gram Panchayat Developmental Plans. It seeks to exploit the enormous collective energy of the people by making them active partners in the development process, decision making and take good advantage of the social capital at the village level. The goal of Grama Jyothi is to bring in much desired accountability, transparency in the functioning of public institutions working at village level and make them responsive to the needs of the people.
benefits: Better coordination of line departments through the planning process for convergence of major Schemes which work in Silos to bring in the synergy of Developmental efforts at GP Level.
Bottom-up planning to be adopted for the optimal utilization of resources and avoid duplication.
To improve the service delivery in core sectors.
To make GP level Institutions more Accountable, Transparent and Responsive to Peopleâ€™s Needs.
To form Functional Committee sector wise for monitoring Goals.
Data is readily available with Gram Panchayats to take up and execute Developmental Works with the concerned Departments.

Functional Committees can monitor various sectors such as Sanitation, Dump Yards, Community Sanitation Anganwadis, Community Sanitation Schools, School Children Details, dropouts (6-14 Years), Orphans Rehabilitation, Grave Yards and information on very poor families.
content.application_process: Online. Have to contact with Gram Panchayat office and as well as your Block office.

faqs.question: What is the aim of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Preparation of Gram Panchayat development Plans to improve the service delivery in core sectors.

faqs.question: When was the Scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The Scheme was launched on 17 August 2015.

faqs.question: This scheme under whose innovations?
faqs.answer: Centre for Good Governance (CGG) developed a web-based application for Panchayat Raj and Rural Development Department, Government of Telangana.
